tools.name: health
tools.description: Health check endpoint to verify server status. Use this tool to confirm the server is running and responsive before attempting other operations.

tools.name: executeSQL
tools.description: Executes SQL queries against the database. Use this tool to run SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, or any other SQL statements. Always verify table names and structure exist before executing queries.

query.description: The SQL query to run. Must be valid SQL syntax.

tools.name: getTableSchema
tools.description: Gets the detailed schema of a specific table including column names, data types, and constraints. Use this tool to understand the structure of a table before writing SQL queries against it.

tableName.description: The exact name of the table you want to examine. Must be a table that exists in the database.

tools.name: getDatabaseSchema
tools.description: Gets the full database schema listing all available tables. Use this tool first to discover what tables exist in the database before attempting to query specific tables or get their schemas.

tools.name: getTools
tools.description: Returns all available tools and their parameters. This is typically used internally for tool discovery and doesn't need to be called manually.
